@Module.Name: Select
@Module.Description: This module is a selection model, selecting the 5 possible component without relativity ranking to be acted on catering to user's intent
@Module.Note: This individual module only select 5 highly related components,without ranking them,and without analyzing the correctness of the components aligning with user's content

Output.<div id=1 class='com.google.android.gm:i: This component represents a clickable area that could expand the compose area. User might need this to select the attachment option.
Output.<div id=5 class='com.google.android.gm:i: This component is for the recipient's field. User would have to add a recipient before sending the email.
Output.<button id=7 class='' description='More: This component is for accessing more options, potentially where the option to add an attachment from Google Drive could be found.
Output.<div id=9 class='com.google.android.gm:i: This button is to attach files to the email. As the user wants to send a Google Drive attachment, this would likely be necessary.
Output.<div id=8 class='com.google.android.gm:i: This is the send button. Once the user has selected the Google Drive file, written the email, and added a recipient, they would have to press this button to send the email.

@Module.Name: Plan
@Module.Description: This module is a plan module, planning the next action based on the selected components, whether click or edit

candidate1.reason: To activate the email composition area.

candidate2.reason: To enter the recipient's email address.

candidate3.reason: To access more options, but it is not directly related to attaching a file.

candidate4.reason: To attach a file from Google Drive.

@Module.Name: Evaluate
@Module.Description: This module is an evaluation module, evaluating the selected components of their contribution to fulfilling the user's intent

@Module.Name: Decide
@Module.Description: This module is a decision module, deciding the final action based on the evaluation result, whether complete or wrong or go on
